menu.label: Optimize your clinical and operational effectiveness

content.title: Microsoft in Health Digital Transformation
content.body: Health needs are infinite, but your resources finite. Microsoft’s powerful and intelligent cloud platforms can enable your digital transformation, helping you better engage your patients, empower your care teams, optimize your clinical and operational effectiveness, and transform the care continuum for your organization.

instruction.text: Move your mouse over hotspots to explore

nodeTeaser.title: Individuals and communities around the world are healthier
nodeTeaser.body: Tap the power and intelligence of the Microsoft Cloud to better engage your patients, empower your care teams, optimize your clinical and operational effectiveness, and transform the care continuum.
nodeTeaser.bodyteaser: Tap the power and intelligence of the Microsoft Cloud to better engage your patients.

hotspots.label: Mobile Care Worker
hotspots.teaser: Securely connect care workers and clinicians to the information and people they need, wherever they are.

hotspots.label: Patient Engagement
hotspots.teaser: Enable new ways of connecting with patients before, during and after their interaction with caregivers using Microsoft platforms and technologies.

hotspots.label: Care Coordination
hotspots.teaser: Leverage an integrated platform to effectively communicate with patients, manage and connect caregivers, and improve quality and reduce costs through workflow automation and optimization.

hotspots.label: Virtual Health
hotspots.teaser: Virtual Health leverages Office 365 & Skype for Business to enable clinical care through telemedicine, telehealth and collaboration at-a-distance.  Connecting clinicians, patients and care teams to provide health services, and coordinate care.

hotspots.label: Remote Patient Monitoring
hotspots.teaser: Remote Patient Monitoring combined with the promise of Genomics can drastically transform the services that the health industry is providing to patients. Market research is showing that there will be fast adoption of new technologies like the Azure IOT Suite and Cortana Intelligence Suite.

hotspots.label: Genomics
hotspots.teaser: Provide the capabilities to take raw data from sequencing machines and produce high-quality reports on identified genomic variants. This processing is common to many different genomic applications, and requires large-scale storage, compute, and systems engineering expertise, as well as bioinformatics expertise thru an ecosystem of partners.

hotspots.label: Clinical Analytics
hotspots.teaser: Improve quality and outcomes of health services by enabling clinicians and consumers to access and analyze information so they can make more informed choices at the point of decision.

hotspots.label: Operational Analytics
hotspots.teaser: Streamline operations and reduce costs by enabling executives and clinicians to share information and analyze structured and unstructured data, so they can make more-informed choices at the point of decision.

hotspots.label: Cybersecurity in Health
hotspots.teaser: Make it possible for healthcare organizations to provide modern eHealth experiences with robust security for today’s healthcare consumer.

hotspots.label: Medical Data Storage
hotspots.teaser: The need for Medical Data Storage is exploding. New and innovative technologies in healthcare are generating more data than before (medical imaging, genomics, Internet of things, etc). Capacity management, legal obligations and cost considerations, but also new cloud enabled possibilities are the main drivers to extent the service with cloud based solutions.
